For credit, show work on all problems.

1)  Find the location of all local extrema of the following function.  Justify using the second derivative test.

$$f(x)=x^4-2x^2+3$$

2) Find the location of all local extrema of the following function.  Justify using the first derivative test.

$$g(x)=\frac{x^2}{3x-6}$$

3) Find the absolute extrema of the following function on the  interval $[-\pi/2,\pi/2]$

$$h(x)=\sin(x)-\cos(x)$$


4)  Find the absolute extrema of the following function on the interval $[0,\infty)$

$$q(x)=x^2e^{-x}$$
